1 - Hello and Goodbye.description: a word we say when we see someone and want to greet them, or when we begin to talk on the phone
a word we say when we are leaving or someone is leaving, or at the end of a phone call
a word we say when we see someone and want to greet them
a word we say when we are leaving someone or when they are leaving, or at the end of a phone call
something we say when we want to greet or say hello to someone in the morning
something we say when we want to say hello or goodbye to a person in the afternoon
something we say when we want to say hello or goodbye to a person in the evening
something we say when we want to say goodbye to a person at night or before we go to bed
something we say to someone to show we are grateful to them for something that they have done for us or given us
said when someone helps us or does something nice for us
used when we want to politely ask for something or politely tell a person to do something
said to show that we are agreeing to do something or we agree with something
a word that shows we agree with something or think that it is true when answering a question
used to give an answer to a question showing that we do not agree or it is not true
a word we say to apologize for something or to say we are embarrassed
a word that we use to greet someone when they arrive

2 - People.description: a person who is a male adult
a person who is a female adult
someone who is a child and a male
someone who is a child and a female
someone we know well and trust, but normally they are not part of our family
a man that you love and are in a relationship with
‌a lady that you love and are in a relationship with
one human being, when gender or age is not relevant
human beings as a group, including men, women, and children
a fully grown man or woman
a child who is very young, usually too young to walk or speak

3 - Numbers 0 to 100.description: the number 0; nothing of something
the number 1; the number of sun in the sky
the number 2; the number of wheels on a bicycle
the number 3; the number of sides in a triangle
the number 4; the number of seasons in a year
the number 5; the number of fingers we have on one hand
the number 6; the number of strings on some guitars
the number 7; the number of days in a week
the number 8; the number of legs on a spider
the number 9; the number of months in a normal pregnancy
the number 10; the number of fingers we have on both hands
the number 11; the number of players on a soccer team
the number 12; the number of months in a yearnumber twelve
the number 13; the number of weeks in a season
the number 14; the number of days in two weeks
the number 15; the number of fingers in three hands
the number 16; the number of pieces each side has in a game of chess
the number 17; the number of days in two weeks and three days
the number 18; the number of squares in three cubes
the number 19; the number of months in a year and seven months
the number 20; the number of fingers and toes that we have
the number 30; the number of days in April, June, September, and November
the number 40; the number of fingers that four people have
the number 50; the number of fingers on five monkeys
the number 60; the number of fingers and toes that three people have
the number 70; the number of legs on seven crabs
the number 80; the number we get when we multiply eight by ten
the number 90; the number of degrees for a right angle
the number 100; the number of years in a century

4 - Family.description: our mother or our father
a child's male parent
a child's female parent
an informal way of calling our father
a woman who has given birth to a child or someone who cares for and raises a child
the lady you are officially married to
the man you are officially married to
a son or daughter of any age
a person's male child
a person's female child
a lady who shares a mother and father with us
a man who shares a mother and father with us
people that are related to each other by blood or marriage, normally made up of a father, mother, and their children
the woman who is our mom or dad's mother
the man who is our mom or dad's father
your daughter or son's child
the sister of our mother or father or their sibling's wife
the brother of our father or mother or their sibling's husband
our sister or brother's daughter, or the daughter of our husband or wife's siblings
our sister or brother's son, or the son of our husband or wife's siblings
our aunt or uncle's child

5 - Colors.description: having the color that is the darkest, like most crows
having the color that is the lightest, like snow
having the color of the ocean or clear sky at daytime
having the color of fresh grass or most plant leaves
having the color of lemons or the sun
having the color of tomatoes or blood
having the color of strawberry ice cream
having the color of carrots or pumpkins
having the color of most ripe eggplants
having a color between white and black, like most koalas or dolphins
having the color of chocolate ice cream
(of color) having less intensity, often because of a small amount of pigment
a quality such as red, green, blue, yellow, etc. that we see when we look at something

6 - Months and Seasons.description: each of the twelve named divisions of the year, like January, February, etc.
the first month of the year, after December and before February
the second month of the year, after January and before March
the third month of the year, after February and before April
the fourth month of the year, after March and before May
the fifth month of the year, after April and before June
the sixth month of the year, after May and before July
the seventh month of the year, after June and before August
the eighth month of the year, after July and before September
the ninth month of the year, after August and before October
the tenth month of the year, after September and before November
the 11th month of the year, after October and before December
the 12th and last month of the year, after November and before January
a period of time that a year is divided into, such as winter and summer, with each having three months
the season that comes after winter, when in most countries the trees and flowers begin to grow again
the season that comes after spring and in most countries summer is the warmest season
the season that comes after summer, when in most countries the color of the leaves change and they fall from the trees
the season that comes after fall and in most countries winter is the coldest season

7 - Time and Date.description: a device used to measure and show time
a period of time that is made up of twelve months, particularly one that starts on January first and ends on December thirty-first
the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
a specific day in a month or sometimes a year, shown using a number and sometimes a name
a period of time that is made up of twenty-four hours
each of the twenty-four time periods that exist in a day and each time period is made up of sixty minutes
put after the numbers one to twelve to show or tell what time it is, only when it is at that exact hour
each of the sixty parts that creates one hour and is made up of sixty seconds
each of the sixty parts that creates one minute
the time of day that is between when the sun starts to rise and the middle of the day at twelve o'clock
the time of day that is between twelve o'clock and the time that the sun starts to set
the time of day that is between the time that the sun starts to set and when the sky becomes completely dark
the time when the sun goes down, it gets dark outside, and we sleep
a period of time that is made up of seven days in a calendar
‌the day that takes place after Saturday
‌the day that takes place after Sunday
‌the day that takes place after Monday
‌the day that takes place after Tuesday
‌the day that takes place after Wednesday
‌the day that takes place after Thursday
‌the day that takes place after Friday
the days of the week, usually Saturday and Sunday, when people do not have to go to work or school
coming immediately after a person or thing in time, place, or rank
either one of two equal parts of a thing

8 - Personal Information.description: the word someone or something is called or known by
the name we share with our family, parents, or siblings
the number of years something has existed or someone has been alive
the information that helps us find a place so we can go there or send a letter or package to that place
the day and month of your birth in every year
the numbers that show on which day, month, or year someone was born
not in a relationship or marriage
an official document issued by a government that identifies someone as a citizen of a particular country, which is needed when leaving a country and entering another one
the number used for calling someone's phone
a sentence, phrase, or word, used to ask for information or to test someone’s knowledge
something we say, write, or do when we are replying to a question

9 - Body.description: our or an animal's hands, legs, head, and every other part together
the part of our body that is at the end of our arm and we use to grab, move, or feel things
each of the long thin parts that are connected to our hands, sometimes the thumb is not included
one of the two body parts that is connected to the shoulder and ends with fingers
the body part that is at the end of our leg and we stand and walk on
each of the two long body parts that we use when we walk
the body part that is in the middle of the leg and helps it bend
the part of our body between our neck and our legs that we cannot see
the body part that pushes the blood to go to all parts of our body
the body part inside our body where the food that we eat goes

10 - Head and Face.description: the top part of our body, where our brain and face are located
the thin thread-like things that grow on our head
the body part that is inside our head controlling how we feel, think, move, etc.
the body part that is connecting the head to the shoulders
the front part of our head, that is the place our eyes, lips, and nose are
a body part on our face that we have two of and use for seeing
one of the two lines of hair that grow above our eyes
the body part that is in the middle of our face and we use to smell and breathe
each of the two body parts that we use for hearing
any of the two soft sides of our face that are bellow our eyes
the lowest part of our face that is below our mouth
our body part that we use for eating, speaking, or breathing
one of the things in our mouth that are hard and white and we use to chew and bite food with
each of the two body parts that are soft and surround our mouth

11 - Opposite Adjectives.description: having a quality that is satisfying
having a quality that is not satisfying
having an amount, degree, size, etc, that is greater than normal
small or below average in degree, value, level, or amount
large or above average in size, amount, degree, etc.
little or below average in size, amount, degree, etc.
having a lot of weight and not easy to move or pick up
having very little weight and easy to move or pick up
having a high price
having a low price
(of a thing) having been used or existing for a long period of time
recently built, invented, made, etc.
extremely pleasing to the mind or senses
not pleasant to the mind or senses
not having any stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
having stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
needing little skill or effort to do or understand
needing a lot of work or skill to do, understand, or deal with
having a high speed when moving or doing something
moving, happening, or being done at a speed that is low
not like another thing or person in form, quality, nature, etc.
(of two or more things) having qualities in common that are not exactly the same
based on facts or the truth
not based on facts or the truth
letting people or things pass through
not letting things, people, etc. go in or out
according to reality or facts
not according to reality or facts
owning a great amount of money or many things that cost a lot
owning a very small amount of money or a very small number of things
feeling confident about something being correct or true
having doubts about or or no confidence in someone or something
based on the truth and without mistakes
having mistakes or inaccuracies

12 - House and Apartment.description: a structure that has walls, a roof, and sometimes many levels, like an apartment, house, school, etc.
a building where people live, especially as a family
the place that we live in, usually with our family
a place that has a few rooms for people to live in, normally part of a building that has other such places on each floor
the bottom of a room that we walk on
the thing we move to enter, exit, or access a place such as a vehicle, building, room, etc.
a space in a wall or vehicle that is made of glass and we use to look outside or get some fresh air
an upright structure, usually made of brick, concrete, or stone that is made to divide, protect, or surround a place
each of the different parts of a building that are divided by their own floors, ceilings, and walls, and are used for a specific reason
the structure that creates the outer top part of a vehicle, building, etc.
the highest part of a room, vehicle, etc. that covers it from the inside
the part of a house where people spend time together talking, watching television, relaxing, etc.
a room that we use to eat meals in
the place in a building or home where we make food
a room we use for sleeping
a room that has a toilet and a sink, and often times a bathtub or a shower as well
the land that is joined to our house and we can grow plants there
on or toward a higher part of a building
on or toward a lower part of a building, particularly the first floor
a small space or room built into a wall, which is used to store things and is usually shelved
any of the pieces making a whole, when combined
a box-like device that moves up and down and is used to get to the different levels of a building
the land joined to our house where we can grow grass, flowers, and other plants

13 - Furniture and Home Appliances.description: furniture we use for working, writing, reading, etc. that normally has a flat surface and drawers
furniture with a back and often four legs that we can use for sitting
furniture with a usually flat surface on top of one or multiple legs that we can sit at or put things on
a comfortable seat that has a back and two arms and enough space for two or multiple people to sit on
furniture we use to sleep on that normally has a frame and mattress
pieces of equipment such as tables, desks, beds, etc. that we put in a house or office so that it becomes suitable for living or working in
a thick piece of woven cloth, used as a floor covering
a piece of furniture with shelves or drawers for storing or displaying things
something we use to cover or decorate a part of the floor that is usually made of thick materials or animal skin
an electrical equipment used to keep food and drinks cool and fresh
an electronic device with a screen that receives television signals, on which we can watch programs
a box-shaped equipment used for cooking or heating food by either putting it inside or on top of the equipment

14 - Jobs.description: something that we use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
the work that we do regularly to earn money
something that we do regularly to earn money
someone who has studied medicine and treats sick or injured people
someone who is licensed to fix and care for our teeth
someone who has been trained to care for injured or sick people, particularly in a hospital
someone who teaches things to people, particularly in a school
a person who designs, fixes, or builds roads, machines, bridges, etc.
someone whose job involves performing in movies, plays, or series
a woman whose job involves performing in movies, plays, or series
someone whose job is to protect people, catch criminals, and make sure that laws are obeyed
a man who brings people food and drinks in restaurants, cafes, etc.
a woman who brings people food and drinks in restaurants, cafes, etc.
someone who drives a truck, bus, car, or another vehicle
someone who is paid by another to work for them

15 - Clothes and Shoes.description: the things we wear to cover our body, such as pants, shirts, and jackets
(usually for men) a piece of clothing worn on the upper half of the body, typically with a collar and sleeves, and with buttons down the front
a casual short-sleeved shirt with no collar, usually made of cotton
an item of clothing that covers the lower half of our body, from our waist to our ankles, and covers each leg separately
a piece of clothing worn by girls and women that is made in one piece and covers the body down to the legs but has no separate part for each leg
a piece of clothing for girls or women that fastens around the waist and hangs down around the legs
a piece of clothing with long sleeves, worn outdoors and over other clothes to keep warm or dry
a short item of clothing that we wear on the top part of out body, usually has sleeves and something in the front so we could close it
pants made of denim, that is a type of strong cotton cloth, and is used for a casual style
a piece of clothing worn on the top part of our body that is made of cotton or wool, has long sleeves and a closed front
a jacket with a pair of pants or a skirt that are made from the same cloth and should be worn together
a long and narrow piece of fabric tied around the collar, particularly worn by men
a piece of clothing often with a brim that we wear on our heads, for warmth, as a fashion item or as part of a uniform
a small bag that is used, particularly by women, to carry personal items
something that we wear to cover and protect our feet, generally made of strong materials like leather or plastic
a type of strong shoe that covers the foot and ankle and often the lower part of the leg
a soft item of clothing we wear on our feet
a loose jacket or shirt and pants worn in bed
clothes that we wear under all the other pieces of clothing right on top of our skin
a piece of clothing worn for swimming, especially by women and girls

16 - Animals.description: a living thing, like a cat or a dog, that can move and needs food to stay alive, but not a plant or a human
a small animal that has soft fur, a tail, and four legs and we often keep it as a pet
an animal that has a tail and four legs and we keep as a pet
an animal that is large, has a tail and four legs, and we use for racing, pulling carriages, riding, etc.
a farm animal that we keep to use its meat or wool
a large farm animal that we keep to use its milk or its meat
a farm animal that has short legs, a curly tail, and a fat body and people usually keep to use its meat
a powerful and large animal that is from the cat family and mostly found in Africa, with the male having a large mane
an animal that has a long tail and usually lives in trees and warm countries
a large animal with sharp claws and thick fur, which eats meat, honey, insects, and fruits
an animal that is small, eats plants, has a short tale, long ears, and soft fur
a small animal that lives in fields or houses, and often has fur, a long furless thin tail, and a pointed nose
a legless, long, and thin animal whose bite may be dangerous
an animal with a tail, gills and fins that lives in water
an animal that is very large, has thick gray skin, four legs, a very long nose that is called a trunk, and mostly lives in Asia and Africa
an animal with a beak, wings, and feathers that are usually capable of flying
a farm bird that we keep to use its meat and its eggs

17 - Basic Verbs 1.description: to have an existence
to no longer be asleep
to rest our mind and body, with our eyes closed
to do a job or task, usually for a company or organization, in order to receive money
to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
to get something in exchange for paying money
to give something to someone in exchange for money
to look at written or printed words or symbols and understand their meaning
to make letters, words, or numbers on a surface, usually a piece of paper, with a pen or pencil
to take part in a game or activity for fun
to give someone money in exchange for goods or services
to stop working, moving, or doing an activity for a period of time and sit or lie down to relax
to clean someone or something with water, often also with a type of soap
to put water, coffe, or other type of liquid inside of our body through our mouth
to make food with heat
to put food into the mouth, then chew and swallow it
to eat or drink something
to form, produce, or prepare something, by putting parts together or by combining materials
to have something such as clothes, shoes, etc. on your body
to make something have no stains, bacteria, dust, marks, or dirt
to have a type of belief, idea, or opinion about a person or thing
to reach for something and hold it
to be upright on one's feet
to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
to write or say the letters that form a word one by one in the right order
to not like a person or thing
to put things together to make them bigger in size or quantity
to give a name or title to someone or something
to bring something into existence or make something happen
to divide a thing into smaller pieces using a sharp object

18 - Household Items.description: a flat, shallow container for cooking food in or serving it from
an object that has a handle with a shallow bowl at one end, we use for eating, serving, or stirring food
an object with a handle and three or four sharp points that we use for picking up and eating food
a sharp blade with a handle, we use for cutting or as a weapon
a flat, typically round dish that we eat from or serve food on
a container that is used for drinks and is made of glass
a glass or plastic container that has a narrow neck and we use for storing drinks or other liquids
a small bowl-shaped container, usually with a handle, that we use for drinking tea, coffee, etc.
a piece of cloth or paper that we use for drying our body or things such as dishes
the substance we use with water for washing and cleaning our body
an object that has hair or thin pieces of plastic or wood attached to a handle that we use for making our hair tidy
a small brush with a long handle that we use for cleaning our teeth
a cloth bag stuffed with soft materials that we put our head on when we are lying or sleeping
a plastic or metal container with a lid, used for putting garbage in and usually kept outside the house
a container with a flat base and sides, typically made of wood, thick card, metal, etc., and often square or rectangular, with a lid
something made for kids to play with, such as dolls, action figures, etc.
an object that we cannot or do not need to name when we are talking about it
a round object that is used in games and sports, such as soccer, basketball, bowling, etc.
a toy for children that usually looks like a small baby

19 - Food 1.description: things that people and animals eat, such as meat or vegetables
the flesh of animals and birds that we can eat as food
flesh from a fish that we use as food
the flesh of a chicken that we use as food
a plant or a part of it that we can eat either raw or cooked
a long fruit that has thin green skin and is used a lot in salads
a round vegetable that grows beneath the ground, has light brown skin, and is used cooked or fried
a round yellow, white, or red vegetable with many layers and a strong smell and taste
a soft and round fruit that is red and is used a lot in salads and many other foods
a long orange vegetable that grows beneath the ground and is eaten cooked or raw
a powder made from dried peppercorn that is added to food to make it spicy
something we can eat that grows on trees, plants, or bushes
a fruit that is round and has thin yellow, red, or green skin
a fruit that is juicy and round and has thick skin
a purple or green fruit that is round, small, and grows in bunches on a vine
a soft fruit that is long and curved and has hard yellow skin
a soft and juicy fruit that has a pit in the middle and its skin has extremely little hairs on it
a juicy sour fruit that is round and has thick yellow skin
the white liquid we get from cows, sheep, or goats that we drink and use for making cheese, butter, etc.
a drink that is made by adding chocolate powder, syrup, etc. to milk
a soft or hard food made from milk that is usually yellow or white in color
a soft, yellow food made from cream that we spread on bread or use in cooking
an oval or round thing that is produced by a chicken and can be used for food
the thick, fatty part of milk that rises to the top when you let milk sit

20 - Food 2.description: the food that we eat regularly during different times of day, such as breakfast, lunch, or dinner
the first meal we have in the early hours of the day
a meal we eat in the middle of the day
the main meal of the day that we usually eat in the evening
a drink we make by soaking dried tea leaves in hot water
a drink we make by mixing hot water with crushed coffee beans, and is usually brown
a sweet food we make by mixing flour, butter or oil, sugar, eggs and other ingredients, then baking it in an oven
a dry, hard, and flat cake that is small and usually has a sweet taste
a type of food made from flour, water and usually yeast mixed together and baked
a sweet, sticky, thick liquid produced by bees that is yellow or brown and we can eat as food
a thick, sweet substance we make by boiling fruit with sugar and often eat on bread
the liquid that exists inside fruits and vegetables or the drink that we make from them
a sweet and cold dessert that is made from a mixture of milk, cream, sugar, and various flavorings
a liquid with no smell, taste, or color, that falls from the sky as rain, and we use for washing, cooking, drinking, etc.
a small and short grain that is white or brown and usually grown and eaten a lot in Asia
liquid food we make by cooking things like meat, fish, or vegetables in water
a mixture of usually raw vegetables, like lettuce, tomato, and cucumber, with a type of sauce and sometimes meat
an Italian food made with thin flat round bread, baked with a topping of tomatoes and cheese, usually with meat, fish, or vegetables
two pieces of bread with cheese, meat, etc. between them
a sweet white or brown substance that is obtained from plants and used to make food and drinks sweet
a natural, white substance, obtained from mines and also found in seawater that is added to the food to make it taste better or to preserve it

21 - Weather and Nature.description: everything happening in the sky and air such as heat, rain, wind, etc.
the result of something burning that often produces heat, flame, light, and smoke
having a higher than normal temperature
having a temperature lower than the human body's average temperature
very bright because there is a lot of light coming from the sun
a white or gray visible mass of water vapor floating in the air
having many clouds up in the sky
water that falls in small drops from the sky
having or bringing a lot of rain
‌(of a period of time or weather) having or bringing snow
frozen water, which has a solid state
everything that exists or happens on the earth, excluding things that humans make or control
the large, bright star in the sky that shines during the day and gives us light and heat
the circular object going round the earth, visible mostly at night
a big round mass covered in land and water, on which we all live
the space above the earth where the sun, clouds, stars, and the moon are and we can see them
a natural and continuous stream of water flowing on the land to the sea, a lake, or another river
the salt water that covers most of the earth’s surface and surrounds its continents and islands
a very tall and large natural structure that looks like a huge hill with a pointed top that is often covered in snow
an area of sand or small stones next to a sea or a lake
a vast area of land that is covered with trees and shrubs
a piece of land surrounded by water
(astronomy) a shining point found in large numbers in the night sky
a very tall plant with branches and leaves, that can live a long time
the colored or white part of a plant from which the seed or fruit develops

22 - Basic Verbs 2.description: to notice the sound a person or thing is making
to give our attention to the sound a person or thing is making
to notice a thing or person with our eyes
to turn our eyes toward a person or thing that we want to see
to look at a thing or person and pay attention to it for some time
to put our hand or body part on a thing or person
to experience a particular emotion
to tell someone about the information, feelings, or ideas that we have
to telephone a place or person
to feel that someone or something is good, enjoyable, or interesting
to have very strong feelings for someone or something that is important to us and we like a lot and want to take care of
to really not like something or someone
to have some type of information about something or to be aware of something
to become knowledgeable or skilled in something by doing it, studying, or being taught
to use words in a question form or tone to get answers from someone
to spend time to learn about certain subjects by reading books, going to school, etc.
to give lessons to students in a university, college, school, etc.
to want something or someone that we must have if we want to do or be something
to wish to do or have something
to possess or use something with someone else at the same time
to move something or someone from one place or position to another
to make a person or thing ready for doing something
to decide on the details of a future activity or event
to make something clear and easy to understand by giving more information about it
to make something full
to move or travel through the air
to experience a specific condition, state, or action
to start or grow to be

23 - School.description: a place where children learn things from teachers
an institution that offers higher education or specialized trainings for different professions
an educational institution at the highest level, where we can study for a degree or do research
a place that children under the age of six can go to learn and play
a room that students are taught in, particularly in a college, school, or university
a person who is studying at a school, university, or college
a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that we can turn them and read them
a small book with plain or ruled pages that we can write or draw in
something made of leather, cloth, plastic, or paper that we use to carry things in, particularly when we are traveling or shopping
an instrument for writing or drawing with ink, usually made of plastic or metal
a tool with a slim piece of wood and a thin, colored part in the middle, that we use for writing or drawing
a small tool used for removing the marks of a pencil from a piece of paper
a type of pen that has a thick tip
schoolwork that students have to do at home
the study of past events, especially as a subject in school or university
the system of communication by spoken or written words, that the people of a particular country or region use
knowledge about the structure and behavior of the natural and physical world, especially based on testing and proving facts
students as a whole that are taught together

24 - City.description: a larger and more populated town
an area with human population that is smaller than a city and larger than a village
a public path for vehicles in a village, town, or city, usually with buildings, houses, etc. on its sides
a financial institution that keeps and lends money and provides other financial services
a large building where sick or injured people receive medical treatment and care
a place where we pay to sit and eat a meal
a place where we go to watch movies
a large store that we can go to and buy food, drinks and other things from
a place where we can send letters, packages, etc., or buy stamps
a long and hard seat that is normally made of metal or wood and two or multiple people can sit on
a place where important cultural, artistic, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public
a large public place in a town or a city that has grass and trees and people go to for walking, playing, and relaxing
a building where we give money to stay and eat food in when we are traveling
(plural) a group of people whose job is to catch thieves, killers, etc. and make sure everyone follows rules
an image that shows where things like countries, seas, cities, roads, etc. are in an area

25 - Free Time.description: an activity that we enjoy doing in our free time
a story told through a series of moving pictures with sound, shown on television or in a cinema
a series of sounds made by instruments or voices, arranged in a way that is pleasant or exciting to listen to
a musical instrument, usually with six strings, we play by pulling the strings with our fingers or with a plectrum
a musical instrument we play by pressing the black and white keys on the keyboard
a musical instrument that we play by holding it under our chin and moving a bow across its strings
the act of moving our bodies through water with the use of our arms and legs, particularly as a sport
a type of sport where two teams, with eleven players each, try to kick a ball into a specific area to win points
a type of sport in which two teams of 6 players try to hit a ball over a net and into the other team's side
the activity of taking long walks in the countryside or mountains, often for fun
a sport in which two or four players use rackets to hit a small ball backward and forward over a net
a vehicle with two wheels that we ride by pushing its pedals with our feet
a specific type of physical activity such as football, swimming, etc. that we do to have fun or stay healthy
an activity often with fixed rules that we do for fun
a digital game that we play on a computer, game console, or mobile device
a set of large folded sheets of paper with lots of stories, pictures, and information printed on them about things like sport, politic, etc., usually issued daily or weekly
a colorful thin book that has news, pictures, and stories about different things like fashion, sports, and animals, usually issued weekly or monthly

27 - Basic or Phrasal Verbs.description: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
to move using our legs, faster than we usually walk, in a way that both feet are never on the ground at the same time
to travel or move from one location to another location
to move or travel toward a place or person
to put our bottom on something like a chair or the ground while keeping our back straight
to quickly move from a high place toward the ground
to push yourself off the ground or away from something and up into the air by using your legs and feet
to come to a place with someone or something
to hand a thing to a person to look at, use, or keep
to discover something or someone that we had lost, after searching for it or them
to move something like a window or door into a position that people, things, etc. can pass through
to move something like a window or door into a position that people or things cannot pass through
to use your hands to move something or someone toward yourself or in the direction that your hands are moving
to use our hands, arms, body, etc. in order to make something or someone move forward or away from us
to begin something new and continue doing it, feeling it, etc.
to make something or someone not move anymore
to make something end
to put together different materials such as brick to make a building, etc.
to perform an action or activity that is not mentioned by name
to receive or come to have something
to rotate or shift our body to face a different direction
to tell someone our name so they can know us, or to tell them someone else's name so they can know each other, normally happening in the first meeting
to go from one location to another, particularly to a far location
to give someone what they need or to make doing something easier or possible for them
to allow something to happen or someone to do something

28 - Transportation.description: a road vehicle that has four wheels, an engine, and a small number of seats for people
a vehicle with two wheels, powered by an engine
a large vehicle that carries many passengers by road
a large, heavy road vehicle used for carrying goods
a series of connected carriages that travel on a railroad, often pulled by a locomotive
a car that has a driver who we pay to take us to different places
an underground railroad system, typically in a big city
a flying vehicle with fixed wings that moves people and goods from one place to another through sky
a large aircraft with metal blades on top that go around
a large boat, used for carrying passengers or goods across the sea
a type of vehicle that is small and is used to travel on water
a piece of paper, text, card, or image showing that we have paid to enter a place, travel with a public transport, etc.
a place or building where we can get on or off a train or bus
a large place where planes take off and land, with buildings and facilities for passengers to wait for their flights
a place where trains regularly stop for passengers to get on and off

the direction towards which the sun goes down, which is on the left side of a person facing north
on or toward the right side

any of the large land masses of the earth surrounded by sea such as Europe, Africa or Asia
